author: jimjim66
title: Striking Yellow Chevy
review:
Chevrolet Corvette, Classic Car becomes a Classic Lego Set

Box/Instructions:

Standard box and Insructions, does its job well, The car looks striking on the front, helps being yellow

 

Parts:

173 parts, so not the biggest set, but similar size to other cars from the speed champion series. There is also a sticker sheet with this set

 

Minifigures: 

Just the one, the driver, in Corvette race overalls which are mainly white, black arms and a red crash helmet. 

The build:

I've built a few of the cars from the speed champions series, even with having the same principle to each car, I've always found every build different which makes the experience better

The completed model:

A nice compact modal, stickers add to the effect and presentation of the set, I'm not a big fan of stickers but they make it look a whole better, it's amazing the set looks like the real car in Lego form great credit to the designer.

Overall opinion:

I like this set, looks great, the presentation in Yellow is superb, I think the car fits in well with other cars from the Speed Champions series and is good value for money, the speed camera is a nice little touch

author: Beyond_The_Hod
title: Quick, fun build, sturdy model
review:
This is a pretty quick build but the finished car is really very cool. It has a great look - very stylish - and the model feels really sturdy and weighty. I let my little nephew play with this one and it stood up to all the abuse a 2 year old could dish out without falling to pieces.

If you are more refined in your LEGO appreciation then this one will also sit very nicely in a display, perhaps alongside the other Speed Champions. The lines and shapes are really pleasing ang the color really makes it jump out when you get a nice bright light on it.

I did a stop motion build of mine which you can see on my YouTube channel . I'd love to get some feedback on it.

author: Wendigo1
title: 1x1 Stickers on a Cheese Slope? Seriously?
review:
As you might have guessed from the title, I had some issues with 75870-1: Chevrolet Corvette Z06. Were they enough to effect my review? 100%. 
 

Minifigure/Scenery: As usual, the minifigure was mediocre. Plain helmet and legs with a absolutely common head. Terribly boring like almost all Speed Champion set figures. The torso is nice for the unique print but that's a small thing really. 
 

The camera is a nice touch though. I might add it to a bank as a security camera or a stop light as a red light camera. Hey, LEGO cities need money too. 
 

Build: This was a bit more intricate that I expected, especially on the front end. The build though is just marred because of the stickers. The headlights are set on 1x1 cheese slopes. Absolutely infuriating to try and apply. Plus they look terrible when you make a mistake, as is easy with this type of piece and sticker. What's worse is that LEGO provides a 1x2 yellow tile with black printing on 2/3rds of it to help with shading on the sides. What if you don't apply the stickers? Well the car looks incomplete. So frustrating. 
 

Overall: While a worthy addition to the lineup, I can't really recommend this set because of how frustrating the stickers made the build; they ruined the experience for me, thinking back on the build yesterday. It's never a good sign when the memorable part of the build was frustration.
